comments.content: I did a mistake... A C F are correct

discussion.content:
the correct answer are A C E.
Default metric command refers to the components of metric

choices.A: The interface used by one router to connect to the other router is passive in the EIGRP process.

questions.question_text: Which of the following settings could prevent two potential EIGRP neighbors from becoming neighbors? (Choose two answers.)

discussion.content: For EIGRP, Router IDs do not have to be unique for EIGRP routers to become neighbors, and the hold timer does not have to match between the two neighbors. However, making an interface passive disables the processing of all EIGRP messages on the interface, preventing all neighborships. Mismatched IP subnets also prevent neighborships from forming.

Bastex - I think you are not right, because in list you can see that netwrok 172.17.1.0/24 is connected in interface of router Core1 FastEth0/2, and not in router 172.17.10.2. So right answer is C, E, F

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

BigBids Incorporated is a worldwide auction provider. The network uses EIGRP as its routing protocol throughout the corporation. The network administrator does not understand the convergence of EIGRP. Using the output of the show ip eigrp topology all-links command, answer the administrator's question.
Which three networks is the router at 172.17.10.2 directly connected to? (Choose three)

discussion.content: In the Question it should be stated "O E2".

I think, the correct answer is D (default route)
we can inject default route into eigrp network in four different ways:
1) network 0.0.0.0 cmd under router config mode
2) ip default-network cmd in Global configuration mode
3) ip summary-address eigrp <as-num> 0.0.0.0 0.0.0.0 cmd in interface level
4) redistributing static default route in to eigrp

It shoud be A. 
Note: When you configure the ip default-network command and specify a subnet, a static route (the ip route command) is generated in the router's configuration.

Source: https://books.google.sk/books?id=f5KssgEfd1IC&pg=PA109&lpg=PA109&dq=In+EIGRP,+when+the+IP+default-network+command+is+configured+on+a+router,+what+is+generated+in+the+router%60s+configuration?&source=bl&ots=8OoWbNFDax&sig=ACfU3U2XFpoc0o9YB9Szg1YdGGmltwpG_g&hl=sk&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwiEtcKn-ubmAhUJ0qYKHfnoAtwQ6AEwDHoECA0QAQ#v=onepage&q=In%20EIGRP%2C%20when%20the%20IP%20default-network%20command%20is%20configured%20on%20a%20router%2C%20what%20is%20generated%20in%20the%20router%60s%20configuration%3F&f=false

comments.content: Sorry, it is working only with staticali configured routes. I tried to configure it, and after configure ip default-network a.b.c.d, that network will be flaged as candidate to default (asterisk - > *)

questions.question_text: In EIGRP, when the IP default-network command is configured on a router, what is generated in the router`s configuration?
